page.title: 12ELLAND BY-PASS
page.content: The by-pass was built to keep traffic, which was using the main road between Halifax and Huddersfield, away from the town centre. There had been several road accidents as heavy goods vehicles had run away down the hill approaching the town and careered through the town centre. Luckily very few fatalities had occurred. The by-pass provides a valuable link with the M62 whilst keeping the town centre free of through traffic. Whereas this has been welcomed by many inhabitants, it has not been popular with traders or shoppers. One parade of shops which had been alongside the old road and enjoyed a fairly busy trade is now empty apart from a hairdressers and a car accessory and DIY store.
